page.title: 19Haughton Village Hall.
page.content: The village hall in the center of the community. The present hall was built 40 years ago. Before that all meetings were held in a little tin hut in Park Lane. It was called the Institute. There is a very keen village hall committee who make sure that the hall is kept in good repair and that all bills are paid. All the organisations that use the hall pay a standard letting fee. This more in the winter time because the heating and lighting has to be paid for. The hall is used quite often. Some organisations meet there every week. It is used during the morning by the Playgroup. It is used for concerts and dances and can be hired by private individuals.Everyone is very proud that Haughton village hall is the best kept Village Hall in Staffordshire.There is a plaque in the hall to commemorate this.
